root: ^Empathy is about understanding what others are going through. It can be hard, but it’s a key skill in life. How empathetic do you think you are?

s: ^I try my best to understand what others are feeling.
^I struggle to understand what people are going through sometimes.
^I’m more focused on myself than others.

Try_To_Understand: ^That’s a good mindset. Being willing to try makes a big difference. When was the last time you showed empathy towards someone?

s: ^I listened to a friend who was having a tough time.
^I tried to help someone with their problems.

Listened_To_Friend: ^Listening can mean the world to someone in pain. You don’t always have to solve the problem—sometimes, just being there is enough.
Tried_To_Help: ^Trying to help others is admirable, but remember, sometimes listening is the best help you can give. Keep it up.
Struggle_With_Empathy: ^That’s okay, empathy doesn’t come easily to everyone. It’s something you can build with practice. What do you find most challenging about it?

s: ^I don’t always know what to say.
^I don’t understand why people feel the way they do.

Not_Know_What_To_Say: ^You don’t always have to say anything. Just being there and showing you care is often enough. Words aren’t always necessary.
Not_Understand_Why: ^People are complicated, and their feelings aren’t always logical. The key to empathy is to accept their feelings without needing to fully understand them.
Focused_On_Self: ^It’s natural to focus on yourself, especially when things are tough. But helping others can also help you feel better. Have you ever tried putting someone else first?

s: ^Not really. I’m too focused on my own problems.
^I guess I could try that more.

Too_Focused_On_Self: ^That’s understandable. It’s hard to think about others when you’re struggling. But empathy can bring perspective and even help you solve your own problems.
Try_Putting_Others_First: ^That’s a great approach. Even small acts of kindness can make a big difference, both for others and for yourself.
